question: Two fly wheels are connected by a non-slipping belt as shown in the figure. $I_{1}=4~kg~m^{2}$, $r_1 = 20cm$, $I_{2}=20~kg~m^{2}$ and $r_{2}=30cm$. A torque of 10 Nm is applied on the smaller wheel. Then match the entries of column I with appropriate entries of column II.
images/e5f6a7b8-c9d0-4e1f-2a3b-4c5d6e7f8a9b.png
**Column I**
(a) Angular acceleration of smaller wheel
(b) Torque on the larger wheel
(c) Angular acceleration of larger wheel
**Column II**
(i) $5/3$
(ii) $100/3$
(iii) $5/2$
explanation: Torque on larger wheel: $\tau_2 = I_2 \alpha_2 = 20 \times (5/3) = 100/3$ (matches ii).
